title: Video: Ajax player’s disgraceful sportsmanship
text:
Video: Ajax footballer Joel Veltman caught trying to con opposition with unsportsmanlike action February 13, 2017 4:46pm Source: FOX SPORTS IF YOU value sportsmanship, look away now. 
Ajax footballer Joel Veltman has produced one of the least sportsmanlike actions seen on a field in recent years. 
With Ajax 2-0 up against Sparta Rotterdam, Veltman received the ball on the right wing, with an opponent — Ivan Calero — preparing to close him down. 
As he controlled the ball, Veltman stopped and gesture towards teammate Bertrand Traore, who appeared to be down injured — seemingly gesturing for play to stop. Joel Veltman battles for the ball with Danny Bakker of ADO Den Haag. Source: Getty Images 
With Calero turning to look at Traore, Veltman seized the opportunity to take off and round his opponent before whipping in a cross, which luckily, Sparta Rotterdam cleared with ease. 
While the debate as to whether — and when — play should stop if a player is down injured, Veltman seemed happy to play on the doubt. 
The 25-year-old has played his entire senior career at Ajax, while he’s also picked up 13 caps at senior level for the Netherlands. 
It seems likely this incident is one he won’t want to add to his highlights package.
